snippet: A conflict that arose after the country’s powerful inspector general ordered the mayor of Bogotá removed from office has captivated Colombians.
abstract: Major political battle between Colombia's Inspector General Alejandro Ordonez and Bogota's Mayor Gustavo Pedro has captivated Colombians for months; conflict began when Ordonez ruled that Petro had violated law by switching city's garbage collections from private companies to city-run service and ordered him removed from office; move triggered protests by many citizens, who found punishment excessive.

byline.contributor: Susan Abad contributed reporting from Bogotá.

lead_paragraph: A conflict that arose after the country’s powerful inspector general ordered the mayor of Bogotá removed from office has captivated Colombians.

headline.main: In Colombia, Two Warring Officials Provide a Portrait of a Nation’s Political Divide
headline.print_headline: In Colombia, Two Warring Officials Provide a Portrait of a Nation’s Political Divide
